Articles.Content:
Can anyone recommend a well tested, free Android application that uses smartphone accelerometers for determining vehicle acceleration?

I need the ability to start and end measuring, determination of minimum and maximum G and a graph of G plotted against time.

Lateral acceleration determination would be a bonus point.

There are several apps available online, but I need KSP user experience. I trust some of you here as quite reliable folks.

I had a good one called logbox back when I had an android phone. This was a while ago though. It would generate CSV files and had no limits. It also didn't do any fancy stuff though. You're left to your own ingenuity for that.
Does someone know a similar application for Ipod?
getting readings is easy, its the signal processing thats hard.
